title.rendered: How Do I Undelete a Podcast Recording?

content.rendered:
Are you a podcast host that just deleted an entire show or audio file off of your device? Breathe, we can restore that recording for you. 

As of 2020, more than 850k podcasts are releasing new episodes up from 500k active podcasts in 2018. There’s no doubt that audio and podcasting is the future of entertainment. With Android podcasts and content creation on the rise ー so are tech mishaps. 

How to Restore Podcast Recordings on Dumpster

Dumpster is practically able to recover most lost audio files. You can view the entire list of supported files here. All popular audio file types are supported: MP3, MP4, FLAC, WAV, WMA, and AAC.

Without further ado, here’s how Dumpster is able to recover podcast recordings: 

Once Dumpster is downloaded, it will begin the process of restoring any deleted files. Once the files are detected they’ll appear in Dumpster’s Recycle Bin.

Simply tap open the Recycle Bin, and select the file you want to undelete. Within seconds, the file will appear back on your Android device. 

We know you’re busy as a podcast host, entrepreneur, content creator, etc. and we don’t want you to waste time panicking on technical difficulties! Which is why we highly recommend you download Dumpster and keep it installed on your device to prevent future accidents.  

Don’t Delete Another Podcast Recording Again! Try Dumpster Free Today!
